fields.name: tool_name
fields.title: the name of the tool
fields.description: The tool must have a well identified name and not being just an item in the menu of a bigger tool (e.g. not the sustainability check option in a development tool)
fields.format: A string specifying a format, but not used by the widget

fields.name: organization
fields.title: The legal entity having the intellectual property of the tool
fields.description: The legal entity having the intellectual property of the tool. In case of shared intellectual property between organizations, all of them can be listed (comma separated).
fields.format: A string specifying a format, but not used by the widget

fields.name: website
fields.title: website
fields.description: The tool must have a dedicated web page (landing page, github repo, etc.) describing its functionnalities, its licencing, etc. Required format is a URL.

fields.name: sub_module
fields.title: sub module of a tool
fields.description: If a tool has multiple modules based on different models and/or data entry point, several lines can be inserted for the same tool. Both the fields 'Tool name' and 'Organization' must have exact same values between the different sub-modules. This field is rarely used and is reserved for complex and comprehensive tools assessing an entire information system.

fields.name: environmental_indicator
fields.title: Environmental indicators

enum: Abiotic ressource Depletion Potential for fossil fuel - ADPf
Abiotic ressource Depletion Potential for element - ADPe

fields.description: Which environmental indicators are provided by the tool such as Final Energy consumption, Primary Energy consumption, Global Warming Potential, Abiotic ressource Depletion Potential, Water Depletion, Product Environmental Footprint Score. The Not Applicable value is usually used for the tools having a “Best Practices” type of assessment.

fields.name: quick_description
fields.title: Quick description
fields.description: Ideally it should be the description provided by the owner of the tool.
fields.example: Cloud scanner combines real time inventory and usage data from your AWS account with Boavizta API to offer a view of your impacts on a given region. It is multi criteria: Primary Energy consumption (PE), Abiotic resource depletion potential (ADP), and Global Warming Potential (GWP) and multi stage: separate impacts of resources Usage and Manufacture. This is similar to what you can get from Datavizta but with automated inventory. Estimations can be filtered by tags. It eases attribution to a specific server, environment, application or service.

fields.name: assessment_type
fields.title: Assessment type
fields.description: What is the main purpose of the tool. Best practices: assessing some functional units against industry best practices without any intention to measure or evaluate footprint. Evaluation: assessing some functional units using a model to estimate an environmental indicator. Measure: collecting the value of an environmental indicator for some functional units.
fields.format: A string specifying a format, but not used by the widget

fields.name: main_perimeter
fields.title: Main Perimeter
fields.description: What is the general scope covered by the tool. Only one must be chosen as the primary one for visual classification purpose.

fields.name: other_perimeter
fields.title: Other Perimeters
fields.description: What is the general scopes covered by the tool. Several value can be chosen to best described the tool coverage.

fields.name: assessed_functional_unit
fields.title: Assessed Functional Unit
fields.description: Which granularity of a digital service or an information system can be assessed with the tool (it does not include the data used as entry point which are covered in the field [data_entry_point]).

fields.name: data_entry_point
fields.title: Data Entry Points

enum: Devices Inventory (both internal and external users of an application)

fields.description: List all the data used to produce the environmental indicators.

fields.name: life_cycle_steps
fields.title: Life Cycle Steps
fields.description: Qualify which steps of a Life Cycle Assessment are tracked. Minimum coverage is usually “usage” when only the energy consumed during the use phase is taken into consideration. This field enables also to qualify the scope(s) being covered for the GWP indicator (GHG emissions in CO2e). Usual steps of an ISO 14040:2006 LCA are eligible.

fields.name: ghg_scope
fields.title: GHG Scopes Covered
fields.description: This category makes it easy to link the product view (life cycle steps) with the Corporate Standard (company scopes), for educational purposes. If GWP is checked in the environmental indicator field, this field indicates which scopes are covered (following GHG protocol Corporate Standard). The scope 2 must be specified between market-based and location-based approach. It should be aligned with the Life Cycle Steps (no scope 3 can be indicated if Manufacturing is not included in the Life Cycle Steps).

fields.name: focus
fields.title: Focus
fields.description: The information can be provided by the organization itself or assessed by Boavizta team. This field describe the main goals of the tool, several values are allowed. This field is for classification purpose.

fields.name: licence
fields.title: Licence
fields.description: Describe the legal environment of the intellectual property of the tool. Business Source - non permissive licence is to be used when the code is accessible but its licence restricts its permitted use such as no commercial use or internal use only if self-hosted; elasticsearch is an example. Closed Source / Commercial is to be used when the code isn’t shared at all.

fields.name: self_hostable
fields.title: Self Hostable
fields.description: Can the tool be self-hosted or is it only a SaaS solution?

fields.name: originating_country
fields.title: Originating Country
fields.description: Where the legal entity owning the intellectual property of the tool is legally based. Value should be of ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 format.

fields.name: logo
fields.title: Logo
fields.description: A URI pointing to an image file file. We recommand square image file with maximum size of 300x300px and maximum weight of 100Kb.

fields.name: inside_models
fields.title: Inside Models
fields.description: Main models being used for the evaluation, comma separated. This field requires that the Assessment Type field = Evaluation.

fields.name: methodology_transparency
fields.title: Methodology Transparency

enum: Disclosed only to internal stakeholders or clients
Disclosed to a scientific panel who did not share the results
Disclosed to a scientific panel who shared the results

fields.description: To which audience is disclosed the following information: inside model, main data sources and main scientific sources (single value).

fields.name: status
fields.title: Boavizta Processing Status
fields.description: Described where the recording stands in the listing process at Boavizta.

fields.name: ref_sources
fields.title: Reference Sources
fields.description: Must be URL with a path separated by comma. A list of the references supporting the claims about the tool made in this table (blog articles, scientific paper, white paper, presentation, webinar, etc.).
